original: Lindholm, Carl Henrik William, läroverksadjunkt, Oskarshamn, f. 11/ 9/89 i Kalmar av C. A. L. o. Emelie Jonsson. G. 46 m. Margaretha Anderson. — Stud:ex. i Kalmar 08, fil. kand. i Lund 11, fil. mag, 12, provår 18. Res. t. Tyskl. 21, 28, 29, 30 o. 31, Engl. m. statsstip. 30. Lär. v. Tärna folkhögsk. o. lantmannask. 12-13, vik. 39 adj. i Kalmar 13-14, lär. v. Mariannelunds prakt. sk. 15-16, e. lär. i Borås 16, vik. adj. där 17, i Vänersborg 17, e. lär. där 18-25, adj. i Norrtälje 24, adj. i tyska o. eng. v. Oskarshamns samrealsk. sed. 34. RVO.
translated: Lindholm, Carl Henrik William, high school teacher, Oskarshamn, born on November 9, 1889, in Kalmar to parents C. A. L. and Emelie Jonsson. Married in 1946 to Margaretha Anderson. - Completed secondary school in Kalmar in 1908, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1911, Master of Arts in 1912, completed probationary year in 1918. Traveled to Germany in 1921, 1928, 1929, 1930, and 1931, and to England with a government scholarship in 1930. Taught at Tärna Folk High School and Agricultural School from 1912 to 1913, substitute teacher in Kalmar from 1913 to 1914, teacher at Mariannelund Practical School from 1915 to 1916, assistant teacher in Borås in 1916, substitute teacher in Vänersborg in 1917, assistant teacher there from 1918 to 1925, assistant teacher in Norrtälje in 1924, and assistant teacher in German and English at Oskarshamn Secondary School since 1934. Awarded Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).

employer.name: Tärna Folk High School and Agricultural School
